results.title: A review on protective roles and potential mechanisms of metformin in diabetic patients diagnosed with COVID-19
results.text_hl: Fascinatingly, in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_COVID_19 @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@COVID-19@@@, treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ was associated with a noticeable reduction in mortality rates and disease severity among @<m>DISEASE_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@infected@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

results.text_hl: Case control study, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (n=219) vs control (n=3604) - Risk of @<m>DISEASE_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@Infection@@@, crude OR 0.69 (0.60-0.80), aOR: 0.95 (0.81-1.11).

results.text_hl: With regard to SGLT2is, a higher risk of @<m>DISEASE_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@genital infections@@@ was analyzed with their use than with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ therapy (OR 1.76, p = 0.03).

results.title: Use of oral anti-diabetic drugs and risk of hospital and intensive care unit admissions for infections.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: After adjusting for covariates, those who took @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ during the study period had 3.3% lower odds of hospital admission for @<m>DISEASE_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@infection@@@ compared to those who were never on @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (OR 0.97, 95% CI 0.95-0.98).

citations.NLM: Rim J, Gallini J, Jasien C, Cui X, Phillips L, Trammell A, Sadikot RT. Use of oral anti-diabetic drugs and risk of hospital and intensive care unit admissions for infections. Am J Med Sci. 2022 Jul;364(1):53-58. PMID: 35077701
